You can probably use <https://kristofferc.github.io/OhMyREPL.jl/latest/features/prompt/> for that

Alternatively, you can customize the prompt, e.g. in your startup.jl file via `atreplinit`, or directly at the `REPL` via `Base.active_repl`. Once you have a handle `repl` to the REPL object, the prompt can be set to a `String` or to a function taking no argument and returning a `String` by setting `repl.interface.modes[1].prompt`
